content.content: Vampires are undead creatures of the night that feed on the blood of the living, known for their immortality, charm, and endless hunger.

content.content: Gain all the traits in the Core Vampire Traits table.
Gain the Vampire's level 1 features, which are listed in the Vampire Features table.
Gain the following traits from the Core Vampire Traits table: Hit Point Die.

content: As a Vampire, you gain the following class features when you reach the specified Vampire levels. These features are listed in the Vampire Features table.

content.content: As a Bonus Action on your turn, you can drink the blood of a Grappled creature or a creature that died in the last hour. Make an Unarmed Strike with Advantage. This attack deals Piercing damage instead of its normal damage type.
On a hit, if the creature has blood, you drain 1 Hit Die.
When you drain Hit Dice from a target, it gains one level of exhaustion, it loses that many Hit Dice and you gain that many Hit Dice (even past your maximum).
The Hit Dice you gain are d8s. You can't drain Hit Dice that the target doesn't have.
Your curse does not come without its benefits—strength and charm are but the beginning.

content: You are Vulnerable to Radiant and Fire damage, damage from silvered weapons, and Piercing damage from wooden weapons. Additionally, Good-aligned holy symbols burn to the touch, dealing 1d4 Radiant damage to you.

Your skin becomes pale, your upper canines grow into sharp fangs, your sclera (the whites of your eyes) become red or darkened, and your pupils become red or another unnatural hue. Finally, you lack a reflection in mirrors and other reflective surfaces.
Whenever you regain Hit Dice, remove that many levels of Exhaustion. You can't remove levels of Exhaustion in any other way.
You don't regain Hit Dice when you finish a Long Rest.

Whenever you finish a Long Rest or after 24 hours pass since your last Long Rest (whichever comes first), you lose one Hit Die. If you don't have any hit dice to lose, you gain 1 level of Exhaustion instead.

You are Vulnerable to all damage while you are in direct sunlight, and you have disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of the attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.
You are no longer a humanoid, but an undead.
You cannot enter a residence without an invitation from a living resident.

content.content: Your curse does not come without its benefits—strength and charm are but the beginning.

content: You don't age and are immune to disease, and you don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You gain proficiency in two of the following skills of your choice. If you are already proficient in a skill, you gain expertise in it instead: Deception, Intimidation, Performance, Persuasion.
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
You can roll a d6 in place of the normal damage of your Unarmed Strike.
You regain all lost Hit Points when you finish a Short Rest.
While you are not wearing any armor, your armor class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

content.content: Whenever you consume Hit Dice, roll them and add your Constitution modifier once for each rolled die. You regain Hit Points equal to the result.
Additionally, as a Bonus Action on your turn, you can consume a number of Hit Dice up to your Proficiency Bonus. You can't consume Hit Dice you don't have, and consuming a Hit Die expends it.
You can use the blood you drink to fuel dark powers. You gain two mutations of your choice.

content: If a mutation has a prerequisite, you must meet it to learn that mutation.
Whenever you gain a Vampire level, you can replace one of your mutations with another one for which you qualify.

content.content: When you gain certain Vampire levels, you gain more mutations of your choice, as shown in the Mutations column of the Vampire Features table.
You can't pick the same mutation more than once unless its description says otherwise, and you can't replace a mutation if it's a prerequisite for another mutation that you have.

You can now attack twice instead of once whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

Your senses have honed in on the one thing that keeps you alive: blood. You can see all blooded creatures within 30 feet that aren't behind Total Cover, even if you have the Blinded condition or are in Darkness. Moreover, in that range, you can see blooded creatures that have the Invisible condition.

content.content: Additionally, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks you make to track blooded creatures.

content: Whenever you deal damage with your Unarmed strike, it can deal your choice of Necrotic damage or its normal damage type.
Your ability to drain the life of others extends even beyond blood. Whenever you deal Necrotic damage, you may regain a number of Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

content.content: Additionally, you can use your Feed feature on creatures that aren't Grappled.

content: At the start of each of your turns, if you haven't taken Radiant damage since your last turn, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to your Vampire level.

content.content: Additionally, your Constitution score increases by 4, to a maximum of 25.
